item.title: Report X-2023060773
item.description:
Report X-2023060773

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-10
  • City: MINNEAPOLIS
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER TRANSPORTED PACKAGE TO DMP AREA AND DISCOVERED PACKAGE CONTAINED FOUR, 4L, PLASTIC BOTTLES OF SODIUM HYDROXIDE, 1.0N (1.OM), BEING SHIPPED AS A CORROSIVE HAZ-MAT PACKAGE (UN1824, SODIUM HYDROXIDE SOLUTION, 8, II, 1 FIBERBOARD BOX X 16 LITERS). RESPONDER DISCOVERED THE CAP ON ONE OF THE 4 PLASTIC BOTTLES, WAS LOOSE, ALLOWING A VERY SMALL AMOUNT OF THE SODIUM HYDROXIDE TO LEAK OUT ONTO THE 4 INNER BOTTLES PLUS OUTER CARTON. ALL PRODUCT WAS PROCESSED THROUGH THE DMP ACCORDING TO REGULATIONS.

item.title: Report X-2023060558
item.description:
Report X-2023060558

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-31
  • City: ROSEVILLE
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package handlers tossed box onto belt and made the box upside down (PH not following indication arrows). Package was caught right away and placed inside a hazmat tote to conceal the leakage. DescribePack: Package could have had a little more protection, cap was a little loose DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: QA noticed PH doing this right away, and was able to catch the package before it did any harm to any other packages and was able to get it contained right away.

When box was opened the cap was loose on one of the gallon of bottles. DescribePack: No internal packaging to help from bottle moving around, no plastic seal/safety seal on cap of bottle. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Box was contained and cap was tightened.

item.title: Report E-2023060133
item.description:
Report E-2023060133

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-24
  • City: FARMINGTON
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On May 24, 2023, one (1) 5-gallon jug of oxidizing liquid was punctured and released approximately one (!) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from EX Environmental (EX) to remediate the impacted site. EX personnel performed a pH test and proceeded to wipe down the impacted surfaces with degreasing solution and absorbent wipes. The crew placed all waste in one (1) vented poly drum for further investigation by R+L.

item.title: Report X-2023060243
item.description:
Report X-2023060243

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-24
  • City: ROGERS
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: loading dock manager called out a leaking hazmat. QA responded and came to retrieve it with a lined tote, performing in-house cleanup on the spot. QA admin brought it back to the damage area and moved it to the drain mats in the incoming damaged hazmat/LQ area. in-house cleanup, awaiting disposition. DescribePack: large jug leaked from cap due to misalignment. it is screwed on crooked, making leakage inevitable. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: placed in lined tote, moved to drain mats

item.title: Report X-2023060189
item.description:
Report X-2023060189

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • City: ROGERS
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: QA admin was in the damage area working on damaged packages when he discovered that the product in this one had suspicious warnings on the labels. he set it aside in a lined tote with a note written on cardboard for the HESS specialist to let them know to take a look at it. he placed the tote atop the drain mats in the incoming damaged hazmat/LQ area. in-house cleanup, awaiting disposition. DescribePack: one bottle leaked most of its contents due to loose cap. majority of spillage stayed inside the outer box. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: placed in lined tote, moved to drain mats

item.title: Report X-2023051370
item.description:
Report X-2023051370

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-23
  • City: MAPLE GROVE
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A HAZMAT AUDITOR BROUGHT THEIR TRAM OVER TO THE DMP AS THEY HAD A HAZMAT THEY SUSSPECTED WAS LEAKING AS THERE WAS A STRONG CHEMICAL ODOR COMING FROM THE PACKAGE AND THE PACKAGE WAS DISCOLORED. THEY INDICATED A PACKAGE WITH BOTH CLASS 5.1 AND 8 DIAMOND HAZARD LABELS. OPENING THE FLAPS RESPONDER FOUND 4 1GAL CONTAINERS WITH ONE CONTAINER HAVING A CAP EXTREMELY LOOSE ALLOWING SOME OF THE CONTENTS TO BE RELEASED.

item.title: Report X-2023051350
item.description:
Report X-2023051350

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-22
  • City: MAPLE GROVE
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A HAZMAT AUDITOR BROUGHT HIS TRAM OVER TO THE DMP SAYING HE SUSSPECTED THERE WAS A LEAKING PACKAGE AS ONE OF THE HAZMATS ON HIS TRAM HAD A STRONG CHEMICAL ODOR. THE AUDITOR POINTED TO A HAZMAT PACKAGE WITH CLASS 5.1 AND CLASS 8 DIAMOND HAZARD LABELS. OPENING THE PACKAGE, RESPONDER FOUND 4 1GAL CONTAINERS WITH 1 CONTAINER HAVING A CAP THAT WAS LOOSE ALLOWING SOME OF THE LIQUID TO LEAK OUT

item.title: Report E-2023050657
item.description:
Report E-2023050657

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-05
  • City: SHAKOPEE
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNIVAR SOLUTIONS USA INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Driver arrived at Part B Storage facility to unload, opened his trailer, and started unloading the drums. It was found that multiple drums had shifted In the trailer and 4-6 drums fell partially over off on the pallets. There were 32 drums of p# 97-8905 picked up from Azz Galvanizing on s/o#13600996 shipping on manifest#024447890JJK. We removed 3 drums from the trailer and picked up the partially fallen drums and that's when it was found some of the drums were leaking out of the top of the open-head poly drums. There was material on the floor of the trailer, totaling <5-gallons. While inspecting more drums it was found more drums showed evidence of slight leaking out of the top of the drums. All employees left the trailer and ER Contractor was called for cleanup. It was found that the drums were closed with latch rings instead of bolt rings and were improperly closed per closure instructions (zip tie not fully tight and not within control holes). Breaking event during transportation caused drums to be compressed and forced a small amount of the waste liquids out the top and coated the side of the drums. Additionally, the pallets were in poor condition causing some of them to break during transportation.

item.title: Report X-2023051291
item.description:
Report X-2023051291

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-19
  • City: MAPLE GROVE
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: HAZMAT AUDITOR BROUGHT HIS TRAM OVER TO THE DMPCAGE SAYING THERE WAS A HAZMAT ON IT WITH A WET CORNER. INSPECTING THE PACKAGE, RESPONDER SAW A BOX WITH BOTH CLASS 5.1 AND 8 DIAMOND HAZARD LABELS WITH A WET CORNER. FURTHER INSPECTION IN THE DMP FOUND 4 1GAL CONTAINERS, 1 OF WHICH HAD A CAP SO LOOSE THAT TURNING IT SLIGHTLY ALLOWED RESPONDER TO REMOVE THE CAP COMPLETELY.

item.title: Report X-2023051192
item.description:
Report X-2023051192

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-19
  • City: ROGERS
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: QA admins spotted the damaged package in the unload yesterday evening. they noticed that the outer packaging was marked as UN1760 but that white labels covered up a Corrosive diamond that one could faintly see underneath them. They placed the package in a lined tote and brought it to the damage area, moving it to the drain mats in the incoming damaged hazmat/LQ area for inspection the following day. In-house cleanup, awaiting disposition. DescribePack: One bottle leaked due to loose cap. Both bottles are stained. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: placed in lined tote, moved to drain mats

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PLASTIC 5 GALLON JERRICAN SLAMMED DOWN ONTO CONCRETE FLOOR. DescribePack: DUE TO IMPACT WITH A SHARP OBJECT CAUSED A PUNCTURE HOLE NEAR BOTTOM OF JERRICAN DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: LEAKING SOME LIQUID OUT.

item.title: Report X-2023051152
item.description:
Report X-2023051152

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-16
  • City: ROGERS
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: the package was sitting in front of a van waiting to be processed. an outside vendor got into the van from the rear and went into the driver's seat to perform maintenance. he did not check in front of the van for packages before starting it up and pulled forward, running over the package and crushing three cans inside. someone notified QA about this. QA retrieved it and placed it in a lined tote, then brought it to the drain mats in the incoming damaged hazmat/LQ area. in-house cleanup, awaiting disposition. DescribePack: three cans got crushed when the vendor ran over the package. they are severely dented. only one of these cans leaked, however. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: immediate in-house cleanup, placed in lined tote, moved to drain mats

item.title: Report X-2023050944

item.title: Report X-2023050863
item.description:
Report X-2023050863

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-17
  • City: MINNEAPOLIS
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: spilldevgrp@fedex.com
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A courier domiciled at our station location in Minneapolis, MN. Picked up a package from a body sculpting clinic and over the course of their route started to hear a rattling from the package. They also stated when they went to look at the package they felt the contents shift and saw that it was being shipped to an oxygen company. Looking for documentation as to the contents, they found Class 2.2 labels placed in the document pouch behind the shipping airbill. The courier presented the package to the dangerous goods specialist when they arrived at the station and with a manager present, the package was opened to find a cylinder marked as containing compressed helium. There were no marking placed on the outer package itself to indicate the contents inside. Package has been secured pending FAA investigation.

item.title: Report X-2023050802
item.description:
Report X-2023050802

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-13
  • City: ROGERS
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: yesterday evening a facer noticed a wet package and pulled it off to set it aside and bring it downstairs later. around 11pm last night he brought it down in a lined tote and brought it to QA's attention. QA saw that it was paint and brought it to the drain mats in the incoming damaged hazmat/LQ area just to be on the safe side, despite not seeing diamonds on it. today HESS specialist inspected it and found that the product is in fact regulated per SDS. in-house cleanup, awaiting disposition. DescribePack: one of the lid clips is missing, and there is some denting near the top rim. the cover came loose, and some of the paint leaked out. most of this stayed inside the box. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: placed in lined tote, moved to drain mats

item.title: Report X-2023050686
item.description:
Report X-2023050686

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-06
  • City: MINNEAPOLIS
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: PACKAGE WAS BROUGHT TO THE DMP, AROUND 11:30 PM, IN THE UNLOAD. IN THE DMP PACKAGE WAS OPENED AND FOUND TO CONTAIN ONE, INTERSTATE BATTERY, BEING SHIPPED AS A CORROSIVE HAZ-MAT PACKAGE (UN2794, BATTERIES, WET, FILLED WITH ACID, 8, 1 FIBERBOARD X 1 POUND. ACID ESCAPED ONTO THE INNER PACKAGE, AND ALSO STAIN THE OUTER CARTON. THE ACID WAS DRAINED AND NEUTRALIZED, THE BATTERY CORE WAS RECYCLED THROUGH UPS AUTOMOTIVE. ALL PRODUCT WAS PROCESSED THROUGH THE DMP. X-2023050687- IN THE DMP PACKAGE WAS OPENED AND FOUND TO CONTAIN ONE, INTERSTATE BATTERY WHICH WAS BEING SHIPPED AS A CORROSIVE HAZ-MAT PACKAGE (UN2794, BATTERIES, FILLED WITH ACID , 8, 1 FIBERBOARD BOX X 1 POUND). THE BATTERY INSIDE, WAS BADLY CRACK AROUND THE POSTIVE POST, WHICH ALLOWED A LARGE PORTION OF THE ACID, TO ESCAPE ONTO THE INNER AND OUTER PACKAGING. ALL CARDBOARD FROM ALL PACKAGES WAS PROCESSED THROUGH THE DMP ALONG WITH THE REMAINING ACID.

item.title: Report X-2023050662
item.description:
Report X-2023050662

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-05
  • City: MAPLE GROVE
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER CLEANED UP THE SPILL AND BROUGHT THE CONTENTS BACK FOR PROCESSING. INSPECTING THE PACKAGE BACK AT THE DMP THE CAP WAS FOUND TO BE CRACKED.

item.title: Report X-2023050653
item.description:
Report X-2023050653

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-04
  • City: MINNEAPOLIS
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: PACKAGE WAS BROUGHT TO THE DMP. IN THE DMP PACKAGE WAS INSPECTED AND FOUND TO CONTAIN ONE, PLASTIC CLOSED HEAD BUCKET, WHICH CONTAINED 5 GALLONS OF AN ORGANIC PEROXIDE/CORROSIVE HAZ-MAT (UN3109, ORGANIC PEROXIDE TYPE F LIQUID (PERACETIC ACID, HYDROGEN PEROXIDE), 5.2 (8). DURING CLEAN UP RESPONDER DISCOVERED THE CAP ON THE 5 GALLON PLASTIC BUCKET WAS DEFECTIVE WITH A TINY PIN HOLE WHICH ALLOWED A VERY SMALL AMOUNT OF THE SOLUTION LEAK THROUGH THE CAP AND STAIN THE OUTSIDE OF THE PLASTIC BUCKET. ALL PRODUCT WAS PROCESSED THROUGH THE DMP ACCORDING TO REGULATIONS.

  • City: ROGERS

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: package handler noticed that a hazmat on the IC belt had a stain on it. she notified QA who came to retrieve it, placing the package in a lined tote and bringing it back to the damage area. they put it on the drain mats in the incoming damaged hazmat/LQ area. in-house cleanup, awaiting disposition. DescribePack: one jerrican leaked from the lid due to loose cap, staining the box interior till it soaked through to become visible on the other side. can still smell the material on the box interior. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: placed in lined tote, moved to drain mats

item.description:
Report X-2023050632

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-10
  • City: ROGERS
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: manager called QA about a spilled package. the QA admin who went to retrieve it noticed that the drum had the cautionary words, "Danger, Corrosive." He placed it in a lined tote along with the spilled material and brought it back to the damage area, placing it on the drain mats for the incoming damaged hazmat/LQ area. when HESS specialist came in the following day, they inspected the product and confirmed that it was a regulated material that required declaration. in-house cleanup, awaiting disposition. DescribePack: one plastic drum leaked from the cover coming unlocked and loose. there are no cracks found anywhere on the drum. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: placed in lined tote, moved to drain mats

item.title: Report X-2023050630
item.description:
Report X-2023050630

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-08
  • City: ROGERS
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: damaged package received a code 10 on the 8th, but by the time it was brought back to the damage area, it was after 9:30pm and the HESS specialist had left for the night. HESS specialist does not work on Tuesdays or Wednesdays and so did not see it until returning on Thursday. Upon inspection, HESS specialist found that the product is an undeclared hazmat. placed in lined tote, moved to drain mats in the incoming damaged hazmat/LQ area. in-house cleanup, awaiting disposition. DescribePack: can leaked from cover due to dislodged and missing lid clip. also some denting. covered in stains. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: placed in lined tote, moved to drain mats

DescribePack: four jerricans are dented. three of these cans leaked from the cap due to loose cap. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: placed in lined tote, moved to drain mats
